Module yae.filesystem

Allows manipulation with files and directories.

Yae applications run on three different platforms * desktop systems (Windows, Linux, Mac OS X) * Android * and iOS.

Each of these platforms handles file I/O a little differently.

Each Yae file has a type which defines where the file is located. The following table illustrates the availability and location of each file type for each platform.

Classpath Classpath files are directly stored in your source folders. These get packaged with your jars and are always read-only. They have their purpose, but should be avoided if possible.

Internal Internal files are relative to the applicationâ€™s root or working directory on desktops and relative to the assets directory on Android. These files are read-only. If a file can't be found on the internal storage, the file module falls back to searching the file on the classpath. This file type is default for Yae files.

Local Local files are stored relative to the application's root or working directory on desktops and relative to the internal (private) storage of the application on Android. Note that Local and internal are mostly the same on the desktop.

External External files paths are relative to the SD card root on Android and to the home directory of the current user on desktop systems.

Absolute Absolute files need to have their fully qualified paths specified. For the sake of portability, this option must be used only when absolutely necessary.

Functions

append (filename, text[, filetype="internal"]) Append data to an existing file.
copy (from_filename, to_filename[, from_filetype="internal"[, to_filetype="internal"]]) Copy file.
createDirectory (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Creates a directory.
exists (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Check whether a file or directory exists.
getDirectoryItems (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Returns a table with the names of files and subdirectories in the specified path.
getExternalPath () Get external storage path
getLocalPath () Get local storage path
getWorkingPath () Get path to current directory
getLastModified (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Gets the last modification time of a file.
getSize (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Gets the size in bytes of a file.
isDirectory (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Check whether something is a directory.
isFile (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Check whether something is a file.
load (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Load a lua or moon file (but not run it)
move (from_filename, to_filename[, from_filetype="internal"[, to_filetype="internal"]]) Move file.
newFile (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Creates a new File object.
read (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Read the contents of a file
remove (filename[, filetype="internal"]) Removes a file or directory.
write (filename, text[, filetype="internal"]) Write data to an existing file.


Functions

append (filename, text[, filetype="internal"])
Append data to an existing file.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • text string The string data to append to the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Usage:

    yae.filesystem.append filename, text, filetype
copy (from_filename, to_filename[, from_filetype="internal"[, to_filetype="internal"]])
Copy file.

Parameters:

  • from_filename string The name (and path) of the source file.
  • to_filename string The name (and path) of the destination file.
  • from_filetype string Type of the source file (default "internal")
  • to_filetype string Type of the destination file (default "internal")

Usage:

    yae.filesystem.copy from_filename, to_filename, from_filetype, to_filetype
createDirectory (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Creates a directory.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Usage:

    yae.filesystem.createDirectory filename, filetype
exists (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Check whether a file or directory exists.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    bool True if there is a file or directory with the specified name. False otherwise.

Usage:

    exists = yae.filesystem.exists filename, filetype
getDirectoryItems (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Returns a table with the names of files and subdirectories in the specified path. The table is not sorted in any way; the order is undefined.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    table A sequence with the names of all files and subdirectories as strings.

Usage:

    items = yae.filesystem.getDirectoryItems filename, filetype
getExternalPath ()
Get external storage path

Returns:

    string absolute path to external storage location

Usage:

    externalPath = yae.filesystem.getExternalPath!
getLocalPath ()
Get local storage path

Returns:

    string absolute path to local storage location

Usage:

    localPath = yae.filesystem.getLocalPath!
getWorkingPath ()
Get path to current directory

Returns:

    string absolute path to current directory

Usage:

    workingPath = yae.filesystem.getWorkingPath!
getLastModified (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Gets the last modification time of a file.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    number The last modification time in seconds since the unix epoch or nil on failure.

Usage:

    lastModified = yae.filesystem.getLastModified filename, filetype
getSize (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Gets the size in bytes of a file.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    number The size in bytes of the file, or nil on failure.

Usage:

    size = yae.filesystem.getSize filename, filetype
isDirectory (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Check whether something is a directory.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    bool True if there is a directory with the specified name. False otherwise.

Usage:

    isDirectory = yae.filesystem.isDirectory filename, filetype
isFile (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Check whether something is a file.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    bool True if there is a file with the specified name. False otherwise.

Usage:

    isFile = yae.filesystem.isFile filename, filetype
load (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Load a lua or moon file (but not run it)

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    function The loaded chunk

Usage:

     chunk = yae.filesystem.load filename, filetype
 result = chunk!
move (from_filename, to_filename[, from_filetype="internal"[, to_filetype="internal"]])
Move file.

Parameters:

  • from_filename string The name (and path) of the source file.
  • to_filename string The name (and path) of the destination file.
  • from_filetype string Type of the source file (default "internal")
  • to_filetype string Type of the destination file (default "internal")

Usage:

    yae.filesystem.move from_filename, to_filename, from_filetype, to_filetype
newFile (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Creates a new File object.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    File The new File object.
read (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Read the contents of a file

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    string The file contents

Usage:

    contents = yae.filesystem.read filename, filetype
remove (filename[, filetype="internal"])
Removes a file or directory. Write data to an existing file.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Usage:

    yae.filesystem.remove filename, filetype
write (filename, text[, filetype="internal"])
Write data to an existing file.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • text string The string data to write to the file.
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Usage:

    yae.filesystem.write filename, text, filetype
